item.description:
Our monthly meeting for November features a return visit by Eugene Kogan, who will present a post-election analysis of political, security and economic developments — and interconnections among the three — primarily as they relate to the United States, but also as they impact our relationships with countries like Russia.

A Senior Political Analyst with Americans for Informed Democracy, Kogan is also Eskind Fellow in Democracy and Public Policy and a Ph.D. student in International Relations at Brandeis University, and holds a 2006 M.Sc. in International Relations from the London School of Economics.

To accommodate our speaker's schedule, the meeting has been moved to a Sunday afternoon. We'll start with the traditional coffee and conversation at 3:00 PM, and Eugene's talk will follow brief announcements at 3:30 PM.

(It is not necessary to RSVP for this event; I'm listing it as a meetup so that you can get e-mail reminders from meetup.com)
item.how_to_find_us: We will most probably be in the Social Hall near the main entrance.
item.name: Humanist Association of Connecticut Monthly Meeting
